Query: Ubuntu refuses to output audio via HDMI

Top-3 Similar Questions: au_1260805: How can I record the audio output using sox?
Top-3 Scripts:
au_1260805: sudo apt-get install pulseaudio-utils lame mpg123

parec -d alsa_output.pci-0000_00_1b.0.analog-stereo.monitor | lame -r -V0 - out.mp3

Explanations about Options.-r:
Assume the input file is raw pcm. Sampling rate and mono/stereo/jstereo must be
 specified on the command line. For each stereo sample, LAME expects the input data
 to be ordered left channel first, then right channel. By default, LAME expects them
 to be signed integers with a bitwidth of 16 and stored in little-endian. Without
 -r, LAME will perform several fseek()'s on the input file looking for WAV and AIFF
 headers.
 Might not be available on your release.

Top-3 Similar Questions: ul_46742: USB audio only outputs white noise
Top-3 Scripts:
ul_46742: aucat -f rsnd/1 -i my.wav # second "raw" audio device 
aucat -f snd/1 -i my.wav  # second sndiod device

Explanations about Options.-f:
Use this sndio(7) audio device. Device mode and parameters are determined from
 audio files. Default is default.
Explanations about Options.-i:
Play this audio file. If the option argument is ‘-’ then standard input will be
 used.
